summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding travel approval requests for prosecutors and staff to conduct witness interviews in connection with the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). It details logistical planning for trips to locations including Pensacola, Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, and Stockholm, Sweden, between 2019 and 2020.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Handles travel bookings and logistics for the prosecution team, including finding refundable flights and coordinating reservations.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Primary requester for travel approvals to conduct witness interviews for the Epstein investigation; coordinates with team members Alison and Maurene.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: CC'd on travel approval requests, asks for specific city details and pushes authorizations through.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Consistently CC'd on travel approval email chains.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Approving authority for travel requests related to the Epstein investigation; sends brief 'Approved' responses.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Frequently travels with Alex and Maurene to conduct witness interviews in various locations for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Travels with the prosecution team for witness interviews; mentioned in trips to West Palm Beach and Pensacola.

persons.name: Nick Siu
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient for conference room payment requests.

connections.description: Frequent travel companions for witness interviews in the Epstein investigation, as indicated in multiple travel requests.
Travel together for witness interviews, as noted in requests for trips to West Palm Beach and Pensacola.
Alex sends travel requests and details to Darlene for booking flights, hotels, and conference rooms.
Alex submits travel approval requests to Edward Tyrrell, who grants approval.
Coordinate on travel authorization logistics, with Michele asking Darlene to push authorizations through.
Both are part of the prosecution team traveling for interviews; their pairing is mentioned as an alternative to traveling with Alex.

events.title: Witness Interview in Pensacola
events.description: Planned interview of a witness in Pensacola, Florida, conducted by prosecutors Alex and Alison, requiring a conference room at the Hilton Garden Inn.

events.title: Witness Interview near Stockholm
events.description: Planned interview of a witness near Stockholm, Sweden, involving an international travel element for the prosecution team.

events.title: Witness Interview(s) in Los Angeles
events.description: Planned interview or interviews in Los Angeles, California, requiring a conference room.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Planned interview in West Palm Beach, Florida, conducted by Alex and Maurene, requiring a conference room.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Planned victim interview in Los Angeles, involving some combination of Alex, Alison, and/or Maurene, requiring a conference room.

keyFacts: The document references the ongoing Epstein investigation under case number 2018R01618, described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
Prosecutors from the SDNY were actively traveling domestically and internationally (including to Sweden) to interview witnesses and victims as late as February 2020.
Travel requests show a pattern of needing to book hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews, indicating formal deposition or interview settings.
The email chain reveals internal DOJ logistics and approval processes for investigation-related travel, including cost considerations and the use of government contract fares.
The team composition for interviews fluctuated between prosecutors Alex, Alison, and Maurene depending on the trip.
